p: LiCa(AlH 4) 3 (plus LiCl) starts decomposing at 120 °C and it ends at about 180 °C. Liu et al. proposed the formation of LiCaAlH 6 in the first dehydrogenation step [ 292]. In the second step (180–300 °C), LiCaAlH 6 decomposed to form Al, CaH 2, and LiH. The two steps released 6 wt.% of hydrogen [ 292]: LiCa(AlH 4) 3 → LiCaAlH 6 + 2Al + 3H 2 (94)
